transparency_law.name: Indiana Access to Public Records Act

response_requirements.initial_response_description: In-person/phone: 24 hours to acknowledge. Mail/fax/email: 7 days to acknowledge. Then provide within reasonable time
response_requirements.final_response_notes: Reasonable time depends on agency size, request size/complexity, pending requests, operational considerations
response_requirements.extension_notes: Reasonable time standard; no fixed maximum

fee_structure.search_fee_notes: May charge for labor to produce copies

exemptions.description: Trade secrets and confidential commercial information
Investigatory records of law enforcement agencies
Attorney work product and attorney-client communications

appeal_process.first_level_notes: Informal review by Public Access Counselor; provides opinions and guidance
appeal_process.attorney_fees_notes: Court may award attorney fees and costs

requester_requirements.purpose_notes: No requirement to state purpose for request
requester_requirements.request_format_notes: May be oral or written; must reasonably describe records sought

agency_obligations.response_format_options: 24 hour acknowledgment for in-person/phone; 7 days for written requests
agency_obligations.presumption_of_openness: All records presumed open unless exempted by statute

oversight_body.name: Indiana Public Access Counselor
oversight_body.role: Provides informal review, opinions, guidance on public access issues
oversight_body.contact_info: Office of the Governor, 200 W. Washington Street, Room 212, Indianapolis, IN 46204; Phone: (317) 234-0906; Email: pac@gov.in.gov

validation_metadata.verification_notes: All fields manually verified from official Indiana statute. 24 hour ack for in-person/phone; 7 days for written. Reasonable time for production. Public Access Counselor provides oversight and informal review. No purpose statement required. May charge actual labor and copying costs. Presumption of openness. Court enforcement with attorney fees.
